intro: Garcinia vieillardii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Clusiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported health benefits. Garcinia vieillardii is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in its native habitat.
